summary: The Environmental Protection Agency partners with states to oversee compliance with federal environmental laws for about 1.2 million industrial facilities, local governments, and others. In 2018, the EPA shifted its priorities to emphasize measures that bring entities into compliance (e.g., training) on top of efforts to address noncompliance. But the EPA put these priorities in place without finalizing guidance on how its offices and states...
title: Environmental Protection: Action Needed to Ensure EPA's Enforcement and Compliance Activities Support Its Strategic Goals
